question: In Young's double slit experiment, an electron beam is used to produce interference fringes of width $\beta_{1}$. Now the electron beam is replaced by a beam of protons with the same experimental set-up and same speed. The fringe width obtained is $\beta_{2}$. The correct relation between $\beta_{1}$ and $\beta_{2}$ is
explanation: Fringe width $\beta \propto \lambda$. de Broglie wavelength $\lambda = h/mv$.
Mass of proton > Mass of electron. Thus $\lambda_p < \lambda_e$.
